com.github.liblevenshtein.transducer.factory

Class TransducerBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.liblevenshtein.transducer.factory.TransducerBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class TransducerBuilder
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Fluently-builds Levenshtein transducers.
    Since:
    2.1.0
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Desired Levenshtein algorithm for searching.

      private Collection<String> dictionary
      Dictionary automaton for seeking spelling candidates.
      private boolean includeDistance
      Whether the distances between each spelling candidate and the query term should be included in the collections of spelling candidates.

      Whether dictionary is sorted.

    • Method Detail

      • dictionary

        public TransducerBuilder dictionary(@NonNull
                                    Collection<String> dictionary,
                                    boolean isSorted)
        Specifies the collection of dictionary terms for the dictionary automaton.
        Parameters:
        dictionary - Collection of dictionary terms to consider when generating spelling candidates.
        isSorted - Whether the dictionary is sorted. If it is not sorted then it will probably be sorted.
        Returns:
        This TransducerBuilder or an equivalent one, for fluency.

      • build

        public <CandidateType> ITransducer<CandidateType> build()
        Builds a Levenshtein transducer according to the parameters set for this TransducerBuilder.
        Type Parameters:
        CandidateType - Implicit type of the spelling candidates generated by the transducer.
        Returns:
        Levenshtein transducer for seeking spelling candidates for query terms (fuzzy searching!).

      • candidateFactory

        protected <CandidateType> CandidateFactory<CandidateType> candidateFactory()
        Builds the factory for spelling candidates, according to whether they should include the candidates' distances from query terms.
        Type Parameters:
        CandidateType - Implicit type of the spelling candidates generated by the transducer.
        Returns:
        Factory for spelling candidates.

      • minDistance

        protected DistanceFunction minDistance()
        Builds the function that finds the distance between spelling candidates and the query term.
        Returns:
        Levenshtein algorithm-specific, distance function.

      • positionTransitionFactory

        protected PositionTransitionFactory positionTransitionFactory()
        Builds an algorithm-specific, position-transition factory.
        Returns:
        algorithm-specific, position-transition factory.

      • stateTransitionFactory

        protected StateTransitionFactory stateTransitionFactory()
        Builds a state-transition factory from the parameters specified at the time build() was called.
        Returns:
        New state-transition factory.

      • unsupportedAlgorithm

        protected String unsupportedAlgorithm(Algorithm algorithm)
        Generates a message for algorithms that aren't supported by various methods.
        Parameters:
        algorithm - The unsupported algorithm.
        Returns:
        A message stating that some algorithm is unsupported.
